intro: Boebera chrysanthemoides, commonly known as the African chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers in clusters. Boebera chrysanthemoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions. Its adaptability to various soil types makes it a resilient plant in both garden and wild settings.
